IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: BEACON COLLEGE, A FOUR-YEAR ACCREDITED COLLEGE, SERVES STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BEACON COLLEGE, A FOUR-YEAR ACCREDITED COLLEGE, SERVES STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES, ADHD, AND OTHER LEARNING DIFFERENCES.
IRS990.Desc: BEACON COLLEGE IS A REGIONALLY ACCREDITED LIBERAL ARTS INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, WHICH UNIQUELY SERVES THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES, ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER, AND OTHER LEARNING DIFFERENCES. FOUNDED BY A GROUP OF PARENTS COMMITTED TO MAKING THE OPTION OF A SUPERIOR HIGHER EDUCATION ACCESSIBLE TO STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES, ADHD, AND OTHER LEARNING DIFFERENCES, BEACON COLLEGE WAS INCORPORATED ON MAY 24, 1989. AT THE TIME OF ITS ESTABLISHMENT, THE COLLEGE SOUGHT AND WAS GRANTED THE APPROVAL OF THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION TO OFFER A FOCUSED LIBERAL ARTS-BASED CURRICULUM ALIGNED SPECIFICALLY TO THE LEARNING STYLES AND SPECIALIZED INSTRUCTIONAL AND SUPPORT NEEDS OF UNDERGRADUATES WHO LEARN DIFFERENTLY. THESE PROGRAMS LED TO THE AWARDING OF BOTH BACHELOR AND ASSOCIATE DEGREES. IN 2003, BEACON COLLEGE WAS GRANTED FULL ACCREDITATION BY THE COMMISSION ON COLLEGES OF THE SOUTHERN ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS (SACSCOC) AND REAFFIRMED FOR THE FULL TEN-YEAR PERIOD IN 2008 AND, AGAIN, IN 2018 (THROUGH 2028). WITH THIS ACHIEVEMENT, BEACON BECAME ONE OF THE FIRST ACCREDITED INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION DISTINCTLY FOCUSED ON THE BACCALAUREATE PREPARATION OF STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES. THE COLLEGE'S FIRST ACADEMIC CONCENTRATION LEADING TO DEGREES AT BOTH THE BACCALAUREATE (B.A.) AND ASSOCIATE (A.A.) LEVELS WAS HUMAN SERVICES. IN 1992, BEACON ADDED A DEGREE CONCENTRATION (B.A. AND A.A.) IN LIBERAL STUDIES THAT LATER EVOLVED INTO ITS CURRENT HUMANITIES MAJOR.SINCE ACHIEVING REGIONAL ACCREDITATION, BEACON HAS ADDED BACHELOR AND ASSOCIATE DEGREES IN: BUSINESS MANAGEMENT (2012), COMPUTER INFORMATION SYSTEMS WITH TRACKS IN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY AND WEB & DIGITAL MEDIA(2005), PSYCHOLOGY (2012), STUDIO ARTS (2013), AND ANTHROZOOLOGY (2016). IN THE ARENA OF BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, THE COLLEGE OFFERS A TRACK IN HOSPITALITY MANAGEMENT AND A MINOR IN ENTREPRENEURSHIP. IN THE SUMMER OF 2016, SACSCOC GRANTED BEACON COLLEGE THE AUTHORITY TO AWARD BOTH BACHELOR OF SCIENCE AND ASSOCIATE OF SCIENCE DEGREES AS WELL IN THE CONCENTRATIONS OF BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, COMPUTER INFORMATION SYSTEMS, AND ANTHROZOOLOGY. BEACON'S ENDURING LEGACY IS THE NATION-LEADING OUTCOMES OF OUR GRADUATES. BEACON'S GRADUATION RATE OF 69% FAR EXCEEDS THE NATIONAL AVERAGE FOR STUDENTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES AS WELL AS THE NATIONAL AVERAGE FOR STUDENTS WITHOUT A LEARNING DISABILITY. BEACON COLLEGE GRADUATES HAVE AN EMPLOYMENT AND CONTINUING EDUCATION RATE OF 83%. THESE EXCEPTIONAL OUTCOMES HAVE GAINED THE COLLEGE NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL RECOGNITION.

FINANCE ADVISORY SERVICES FOR BONDS ISSU

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PAID MEMBERSHIP DUES TO NAICU THAT ENGAGES IN LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

COLLECTION ITEMS CONSIST OF ART OBJECTS THAT ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS IS CATALOGUED, PRESERVED, CARED FOR, AND KEPT UNENCUMBERED. ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED CONTINUOUSLY. COLLECTION ITEMS ACQUIRED EITHER THROUGH PURCHASE OR DONATION ARE NOT CAPITALIZED.
THE ORGANIZATION INTENDS TO USE ITS ENDOWMENTS TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR FUTURE SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE COLLEGE IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX ONLY ON NET UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE COLLEGE HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED IT HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND HAS NOT RECORDED ANY OBLIGATIONS FOR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: LINE 6 - EXPLANATION OF GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL AID:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BEACON COLLEGE RECEIVES FLORIDA TUITION ASSITANCE AND IT HAS NEVER HAD ITS RIGHT TO FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY REVOKED.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: THE BEACON IN TUSCANY PROGRAM IS A ONE SEMESTER STUDY ABROAD OPPORTUNITY OFFERED TO CURRENT BEACON COLLEGE STUDENTS. STUDENTS TAKE A NORMAL COURSE LOAD OF CLASSES WHICH ARE TAUGHT BY BEACON FACULTY TEMPORARILY ON ASSIGNMENT IN ITALY. STUDENTS ARE ALSO TAKEN ON EDUCATIONAL FIELD TRIPS TO VARIOUS CITIES IN ITALY.

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.DescriptionOfNonCashAsstTxt: ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION & REDUCED RATE FOR ROOM AND BOARD.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION & REDUCED RATE FOR ROOM AND BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIMARILY STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BEACON SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT AID (DISCOUNTED EDUCATION COSTS) BASED ON DEMONSTRATING FINANCIAL NEED AS DEFINED BY FEDERAL STUDENT AID GUIDELINES. THE DISCOUNT APPLIED IS AWARDED ON A FORMULA ASSIGNING THE LARGEST BEACON DISCOUNT TO THE NEEDIEST STUDENTS. THERE ARE A FEW SCHOLARSHIPS(DISCOUNTS) AWARDED BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM EDUCATIONAL PROFESSIONALS(PROFESSIONAL EDUCATOR SCHOLARSHIP)AND/OR A GRANT (RAISE ME) OFFERED TO STUDENTS WHO ACHIEVED SPECIFIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS IN HIGH SCHOOL. IN THESE CASES EVERYONE AUTOMATICALLY RECEIVES THE SAME LEVEL OF REDUCTION BASED ON PREDETERMINED CRITERIA. INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS ARE ALSO ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE AN EDUCATIONAL COST REDUCTION BY DEMONSTRATING FINANCIAL NEED. THESE GRANTS VARY AND ARE DETERMINED BY THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. IN ORDER FOR STUDENTS TO CONTINUE TO RECEIVE NEED-BASED BEACON COLLEGE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS MUST RE-APPLY EACH YEAR USING THE FEDERAL APPLICATION FOR STUDENT AID. STUDENTS MUST ALSO REMAIN IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING AS DESCRIBED IN THE BEACON ACADEMIC CATALOG. SHOULD THE STUDENT/FAMILY FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCE CHANGE, THE STUDENT MAY RECEIVE A REDUCTION OR INCREASE IN A BEACON GRANT. IN THE CASE OF NON-NEED BASED BEACON COLLEGE GRANTS; STUDENTS ARE MONITORED ANNUALLY TO ASSURE THEY ARE MAINTAINING GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.
DR. GEORGE J. HAGERTY- HOUSING/AUTO ALLOWANCE WAS INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE INCOME.

BEACON COLLEGE ESTABLISHES DIRECTOR COMPENSATION USING ALL OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS: (1) REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES; (2) USE OF DATA AS TO COMPARABLE COMPENSATION; (3) CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION AND RECORDKEEPING.
TO REFINANCE PRIOR YEAR TAXABLE MORTGAGE DEBT & FUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF A RESIDENCE HALL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BEACON COLLEGE HAS DEVELOPED EXTENSIVE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR GIFT ACCEPTANCE. "BEACON'S FUNDRAISING PRIORITIES AND POLICES ARE ESTABLISHED WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. POLICIES ARE FORMULATED AND RECOMMENDED TO THE COMMITTEE ON INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNICATIONS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES BY THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNICATIONS WITH COUNSEL OF THE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT." EXCERPTED FROM BEACON COLLEGE, "DEVELOPMENT POLICY AND PROCEDURES," SPRING 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEMBERS ARE PROVIDED A DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 FOR THEIR REVIEW, CHANGES NOTED BY MEMBERS ARE MADE AS NECESSARY, AND THE FINAL FORM 990 IS THEN FILED UPON SIGNATURE OF AN AUTHORIZED OFFICER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A BOARD MEMBER SHALL BE CONSIDERED TO HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IF HE OR SHE, OR PERSONS OR ENTITIES WITH WHICH HE OR SHE IS AFFILIATED, HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT INTEREST THAT MAY IMPAIR OR MAY REASONABLY APPEAR TO IMPAIR HIS OR HER INDEPENDENT, UNBIASED JUDGMENT IN THE DISCHARGE OF HIS OR HER RESPONSIBILITIES TO THE INSTITUTION. BOARD MEMBERS SHALL DISCLOSE TO THE BOARD ANY ACTUAL, APPARENT, OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AT THE EARLIEST PRACTICAL TIME. A BOARD MEMBER WHO HAS MADE SUCH A DISCLOSURE SHALL ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON SUCH MATTERS, OR PARTICIPATING IN OR OTHERWISE INFLUENCING THE DELIBERATIONS OF THE BOARD IN RELATION TO THE MATTER FOR WHICH AN ACTUAL, APPARENT, OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT IS ACKNOWLEDGED. THE BOARD MEETING MINUTES SHALL REFLECT THAT A DISCLOSURE WAS MADE AND NOTE THE BOARD MEMBERS' ABSTENTION FROM VOTING AND ABSENCE DURING BOARD DELIBERATIONS. A BOARD MEMBER WHO IS RECUSED MAY BE COUNTED FOR PURPOSES OF DETERMINING THE PRESENCE OF A QUORUM AT THE MEETING, BUT SHALL NOT BE COUNTED FOR PURPOSES OF DETERMINING THE PRESENCE OF A QUORUM FOR REQUISITE BOARD ACTION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, EVERY BOARD MEMBER SHALL COMPLETE AND SIGN A DISCLOSURE FORM ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, AND UPDATE THE FORM AS PROMPTLY AS POSSIBLE FOLLOWING KNOWLEDGE OF CONDITIONS THAT MAY CREATE A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. BOARD MEMBERS SERVE AS VOLUNTEERS AND ARE NOT COMPENSATED FOR THEIR SERVICES. THEY MAY BE REIMBURSED FOR TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER REASONABLE DIRECT EXPENSES WHILE ENGAGED IN THE DISCHARGE OF THEIR OFFICIAL BOARD DUTIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING CEO AND TOP MANAGEMENT COMPENSATION INCUDES ALL OF THESE ELEMENTS: (1) REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES; (2) USE OF DATA AS TO COMPARABLE COMPENSATION; (3) CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION AND RECORDKEEPING. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES VOTES ON COMPENSATION PACKAGES FOR OFFICER'S AND KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION, USING COMPARABILITY DATA FROM SIMILAR EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FOR A REASONABLE COPYING CHARGE.
